author: terence0083
content: This is different though. It's only on reorg. You call `newPayload` with reorg'ed blobs. Not current blobs

author: m.kalinin
content: I see, so it requires an optional `blobs` field in the method and a logic of traversing reorged blocks which can be implementation specific. Curious what EL client devs thinking on exposing a separate optional method for this purpose. Optional meaning that it can be a no op if a client doesn't support this feature

author: potuz
content: Newpayload is out of the question, but Peter's comment is about reintroducing, which is not a hot path for us, we can send blobs in the background on reorgs

author: m.kalinin
content: Yeah, I can see now. I am thinking that we can introduce a method to pass blobs and implement the logic after the HF and roll it out in uncoordinated fashion to avoid delaying Dencun by this additional chunk of work

author: terence0083
content: I'd persoanlly be favoring not worrying about delay but spend enough time and get this right before the fork

author: djrtwo

author: m.kalinin
content: I would say that if one as submitted a block transaction that for any reason is not in the justified/finalized chain then it should be re-submitted anyway. The reasons for that can be different and reorgs would be just one of them

author: terence0083
content: I checked how Arbitrum works today. Sequencer does resubmit reorg'ed call data tx and it won't forget about it until it has been finalized
